titles.title: Eighteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time - Year C Psalms

properties.verseOrder: c1 v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

verse.name: c1
verse.lines:
O Lord, you have been
our refuge,
from generation
to generation.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
You turn man back to dust,
and say,
"Return, O children of me."
To your eyes a thousand years
are like yesterday,
come and gone,
or like a watch in the night.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
You sweep them away
like a dream,
like grass which is fresh
in the morning.
In the morning it sprouts
and is fresh;
by evening it withers
and fades.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Then teach us
to number our days,
that we may gain
wisdom of heart,
Turn back, O lord! How long?
Show pity to your servants.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
At dawn, fill us with
your merciful love;
we shall exult
and rejoice all our days.
Let the favour of the Lord
our God be upon us;
O give success to the
work of our hands.
